headline: Southern CEO Womack on Power Demands, Trump's PJM Plan
summary: Chris Womack, chief executive officer of utility giant Southern Co., says electricity demand is expected to grow by as much as 8% to 10%, citing what he calls "incredible demand and opportunity" looking ahead. He also comments on President Trump's plans to sell energy directly to some technology companies through an auction process as a "good idea". Womack was speaking with Bloomberg TV on the sidelines of the 2026 World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

Womack was speaking with Bloomberg TV on the sidelines of the 2026 World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.
